title: Lower prices: New group of T206s
author: Rob D.

posts.post_title: Lower prices: New group of T206s
posts.post_content:
More cards from a collection of a longtime hobbyist. These have been tucked away in an album for the past three decades or so.

Note: I don't subscribe to the theory of pricing an item on the B/S/T at double what you reasonably hope to get, then reducing it by 5 or 10 percent and bumping the listing for "price reductions" every 2-3 days. Am I sometimes guilty of overvaluing (and undervaluing) a card? Sure. But I list stuff at prices I hope will result in quick sales. So though I would never tell someone not to email me an offer of $20 on a $22 card, unless it's the last card remaining, chances are pretty good your offer will be declined. There are plenty of other folks on 54 who will be happy to play Pawn Stars with you, and those sellers are very easy to identify. Thanks.

(I should add, if you honestly feel a price is way out of line, email me. The worst that I can say is no.)

Prices are delivered within the United States. PayPal is fine. No need to "gift" your payment. A commitment to buy takes precedence over an ongoing negotiation. :rolleyes:

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]Feel free to email any questions.[/URL]

Thanks again,

Rob

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]wolfie51sb at aol.com [/URL]

***
